9.7.21  8:13 am   I think I figured out why you usually answer questions like "what's your favorite song you made" with "i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite."  I think you answer like this because, if you did have a favorite song you made, then that one would be considered "the best" to you, and no other song would be able to beat that, giving you the feeling that making new songs is pointless.  Is this correct?

      that sounds mostly correct

9.7.21  7:19 am   Is it really bad to spend a lot of time learning how to make something before you try making it as long as the learning process doesn't bore you so much you quit and never make anything?

      you will learn much quicker and stronger if you are having a hands-on experience

9.7.21  1:57 am   Whenever I try to make good music it always turns out bad, but whenever I'm just fucking around I end up making good music.  Why is this happening?

      because the world is a fun place

9.7.21  12:21 am   Hey bill, how's it going? Quick question, if I'm writing in a mode of the major scale, do I change the key signature to fit? For example, if I'm writing in G Lydian, a mode of the D major scale, do I make the key signature D Major (##) or do I keep the key signature as G Major (#) and just use an accidental next to every fourth degree (so, every C, I would change to C#)
Thanks man

      using a 2-sharp key signature for G lydian is going to be very convenient. usually it's nice to write "G lydian" at the top of the page, so people don't get the wrong idea

9.6.21  9:15 am   any opinions on how to make my electric guitar sound softer? i have a good tone i guess, but i want to make it much more softer, i wan't to have that sort of thing when it feels like the string is not even plucked at that moment, but a while ago, continuously, like a violin but with less burst... i can't manage to get that feel trying out my effects and i'm kinda stuck here... even if you are not mainly a guitar player, i would consider your opinions from a sound design perspective, thank you

      it sounds like what you are describing is what would happen if you turn your volume knob down, play the note, and then turn up the volume while you are still holding the note. if you get a volume pedal, then you can do the volume with your foot so you can have both hands free to play the notes

9.6.21  2:47 am   how to learn harmony??

      take your favorite songs and try to just find 1 place in the song where you can add 1 extra note, at the same time as the melody note. choose wisely

9.5.21  8:57 pm   how to find the area of a trapazoid

      i think you can duplicate it and flip it over and fit it together to form a parallelogram. then multiply one of the long sides times the ........ perpendicular distance to the other long side. then take half of the result because you doubled the shape
